abstract: Alessandra Stanley An Appraisal column reflects on cultural pervasiveness of Star Trek character Spock, noting that actor Leonard Nimoy was never able to move beyond that role in public perception.
lead_paragraph: The irresistibly distinct, coldblooded and cerebral Mr. Spock was something new and long-lasting.

headline.main: For Leonard Nimoy, Spock’s Hold Made Reaching Escape Velocity Futile
headline.print_headline: Mr. Spock Had a Hold on Him, and Us

snippet: The irresistibly distinct, coldblooded and cerebral Mr. Spock was something new and long-lasting.
